SEARCH

Class Library_OLD

java.lang.Object
Library_OLD
public class Library_OLD extends Object
Legacy in-memory library for the original CheckPoint phases.

This class keeps games in a simple List in memory and exposes basic operations such as list, add, remove, update, import, and reporting. It mirrors the behavior of DbLibrary closely enough so that the earlier JUnit tests still compile and run, even after the app moved to a database-backed implementation.

Role in the overall system: test-only, in-memory version of the game library. The main GUI and CLI use DbLibrary instead.

    • updateField

      public String updateField(int id, String field, String newValue)
      Updates one field of a game by id and returns a status message.
      Parameters:
      id - id of the game to update
      field - field name to update (name, platform, status, priority, ownership)
      newValue - new value for the given field
      Returns:
      status message describing the result

    • importFromFile

      public String importFromFile(Path path)
      Loads games from a UTF-8 text file and returns a summary message. Existing games are left in place; imported games are appended.
      Parameters:
      path - path to the text file to import
      Returns:
      summary message with added/skipped counts

    • findById

      public Optional<Game> findById(int id)
      Looks up a game by its id.
      Parameters:
      id - id to search for
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the game if found, or empty otherwise

    • scoreFor

      public int scoreFor(Game game)
      Computes a backlog score for a single game.

      Status contributes a weight (UNPLAYED > PLAYING > BEATEN) and is combined with priority to give a simple "tackle this next" score.

      Parameters:
      game - game to score
      Returns:
      numeric score where higher means more urgent

    • backlogReport

      public String backlogReport(int topNumber)
      Builds a text report with overall stats and the top Number games to tackle next.
      Parameters:
      topNumber - how many top-scoring games to include
      Returns:
      multi-line text report with backlog stats and top games
